alert.note: Alert for Wilson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 01 at 8:11PM CDT until June 02 at 10:43PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas... Fall River at Fredonia affecting Wilson County. For the Fall River...including Fredonia...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Fall River at Fredonia. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Flood waters reach within 50 feet of residential homes along the south bank located 1 mile south of Fredonia off of Highway 96. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:46 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 28.4 feet and cresting. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue falling to 6.0 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Fall River Fredonia 17.0 28.4 Wed 7 pm CDT 7.0 7.0 6.2 &&
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
